author: Dennis S
text:
In an attempt to tap revenue from political parties that would spend funds during campaign ahead of polls, the India Post has amended a clause in the Post Office Guide and opened up avenues for the political parties to use Direct Post.

Through Direct Post – a cost-effective direct mail service for un-addressed articles, the sender can specify the areas (and number of articles for each area), in which the sender wishes the Direct Post articles to be distributed.

Reaching out to the voters

“An amendment was made to the clause–213(1) of Post Office Guide, Part I thus opens up avenues for conveying messages of political parties through postal services such as Direct Post and ePost to reach out to their potential voters,” Postmaster General Mervin Alexander for Chennai Region said.

The clause had earlier prevented political parties from using postal services to further their interests.

Political parties can disseminate information which they desire using the services, provided these messages do not go against the interest of the State or foreign relations or communal harmony or security, as enshrined in the Indian Post Office Act.
title: Political parties can now officially use Direct Post
